english: I want to go somewhere fun.

transliteration: ma tīgi níšrab ʔáhwa f- márra.
arabic: ما تيجي نِشْرب قهْوَة في مرّة.

english: They’ve never been out of Egypt.
I usually go to work by car, but I sometimes walk.
transliteration: ʔána 3ādatan barūɧ iššúɣlə bi-l3arabíyya, bass ʔaɧyānan bámši.
arabic: أنا عادةً بروح الشُّغْل بِالعربية، بسّ أحْياناً بمْشي.

english: I often see him at the café.
The cat somehow got in the house.
I haven’t finished my coffee yet.
I haven’t finished my coffee yet.
It’s hot today. Let’s stay inside.
transliteration: iddúnya ɧarr innahárda. xallīna gúwwa ʔáɧsan.
arabic: الدُّنْيا حرّ النّهارْده.  خلّينا جُوّه أحْسن.

english: The apartment is on the fourth floor.
How much do you pay in rent?
The gardener comes once a week.
Ask the doorman to wash our car this afternoon.
transliteration: xálli lbuwwēb yɣássil issayyāra ba3d iɖɖúhur.
arabic: خلّي البُوّاب يْغسِّل السِّيّارة بعْد الضُّهُر.

english: to hang a picture on the wall
arabic: علّق صورة على الحيْط، يْعلِّق صورة على الحيْط

english: I love that painting hanging over the sofa.
transliteration: ktīr ɧabbēt iʂʂūra lm3állʔa fōʔ iʂʂōfa.
arabic: كْتير حبّيْت الصّورة المْعلّْقة فوْق الصّوفة.

english: to beat the dust out of a carpet
transliteration: náffaɖ issijjēdi min ilɣábra, ynáffiɖ issijjēdi min ilɣábra
arabic: نفّض السِّجّادِة مِن الغبْرة، يْنفِّض السِّجّادِة مِن الغبْرة

english: Could you turn off the light in the kitchen, please?
transliteration: fīk tʈáffi llámba b-ilmáʈbax law samáɧt?
arabic: فيك تْطفّي اللمْبة بِالمطْبخ لوْ سمحْت؟

english: The power went out for an hour this afternoon.
The only thing I want to do this evening is watch TV.
transliteration: -šši ilwaɧīd yálli báddi á3mlu ha-llēli húwwi innū áɧɖar tilfizyōn.
arabic: الشّي الوَحيد يَلّي بدّي أعْمْلو هالْليْلِة هُوِّ إنّو إحْضر تِلْفِزْيوْن.

english: Dinner's ready! Come to the table!
Just put it in the microwave for two minutes.
I heated up the soup in the microwave.
double bed, queen bed, king bed
to sleep, fall asleep, go to sleep, go to bed
I only got four or five hours’ sleep last night.
transliteration: mbēriɧ nímit bass šī árba3 aw xámas sē3āt.
arabic: مْبارِح نِمِت بس شي أرْبع أوْ خمس ساعات.

english: What time did you go to bed?

transliteration: ʈabb rāsu u nēm, yʈubb rāsu u ynēm
arabic: طبّ راسو ونام، يْطُبّ راسو ويْنام

english: I was feeling sleepy, so I took a short nap.
unable to get to sleep, have a restless night’s sleep
You don’t look like you slept well.
I woke up at six o’clock in the morning.
I woke up at six o’clock in the morning.
A loud noise woke me up.
transliteration: fiʔít min wára ʂōt ʔáwi u múz3ij.
arabic: فِقِت مِن وَرا صوْت قَوي ومُزْعِج.

english: to get up, get out of bed
transliteration: ʔām min ittáxit, yʔūm min ittáxit
arabic: قام مِن التّخِت، يْقوم مِن التّخِت

english: I set my alarm for six in the morning.
to dry off, towel oneself off
to get on, get in, take (a bus, taxi, etc.)
to get off, get out of
I usually go to work by bus.
I take the metro every day.
The traffic is horrible right now!
Forget going downtown right now. It’s rush hour.
transliteration: balāš tínzal wisʈ ilbálad dilwáʔti. di sā3it izzúrwa.
arabic: بلاش تِنْزِل وِسْط البلد دِلْوَقْتي.  دي ساعِةْ الذُّرْوَة.

english: to have the right of way
You can just drop me off on the corner.
to give a lift to, take
Can you give me a ride home?
He never uses his turn signal.
I put the car in reverse and started backing up.
transliteration: ʔána gibtə maršidīr wi rigí3tə bi-l3arabíyya.
arabic: أنا جِبْت مارْشِدير و رِجِعْت بِالعربية.

english: to speed, go over the speed limit
The police pulled me over for speeding.
arabic: الشُّرْطة وَقّفِتْني على جنْب بِسبب السُّرْعة.

english: to put on one’s seatbelt, wear one’s seat belt
There’s a dent in the side of the car!
arabic: فيه خبْطة في العربية مِن الجنْب!

english: Turn on your headlights when it starts to get dark.
to get in an accident, have an accident
He crashed (his car) into a tree.
The car was totaled in the accident.
a train/metro pass for a month or several months
undershirt (also: T-shirt, soccer jersey; UK: vest)
undershirt (also: T-shirt, soccer jersey; UK: vest)
to take __ out of one’s pocket
What size shoes do you wear?
I’m not sure about my (clothing) size.
I’m not sure about my (clothing) size.
to wear, to get dressed, to put on
What are you going to wear today?
He took a shower, got dressed, and left for work.
just right (not too loose or tight)
I think I need the next size up.
This shirt is wrinkled. I need to iron it.

arabic: أيْه ده، إنْتَ لابِس نضّارة النّهارْده!

english: a diamond ring, gold bracelet, and silver necklace
transliteration: xāʈim ʔalmāʐ, ɣiwēša dáhab, wi 3uʔdə fáɖɖa
arabic: خاتِم ألْماظ، غِويْشة دهب و عُقْد فضّة

english: to hide or repress one's feelings
to to break off relations with s.o. because of a dispute
to make false boasts or claims
I have some relatives that live in New York.
arabic: أنا عنْدي قرايِب عايْشين في نْيويوْرْك.

english: How many children do you have?
My brother and my friend’s brother came with me.
transliteration: ʔaxūya w ʔaxū ȿáɧbi gum ma3āya.
arabic: أخويا و أخو صاحْبي جُم معايا.

english: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
I have two older sisters and one younger brother.
transliteration: 3ándi ʔuxtēn ʔákbar mínni wi ʔaxxə ʔáȿɣar mínni.
arabic: عنْدي أُخْتيْن أكْبر مِنّي و أخّ أصْغر مِنّي.

english: I’m the youngest in my family.

* Note that a رغيف refers to something different than what Americans would typically think of as a loaf of bread. A رغيف is a whole pita bread or عيش بلدي. Here's a photo of a boy carrying a bunch of أرغفة.
What do you feel like eating?
He took a bite of the hamburger and put it down.
transliteration: ʔáʈam ʔáʈma min ilhambúrgur wi sābu.
arabic: قطم قطْمة مِن الهمْبُرْجُر و سابُه.

english: to take a bite of, take a sip of
She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
transliteration: xádit šáfʈit máyya wi sābit ilkubbāya.
arabic: خدِت شفْطِةْ ميّة و سابِت الكوبّايَة.

english: She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
transliteration: xádit buʔʔə máyya wi sābit ilkubbāya.
arabic: خدِت بُقّ ميّة و سابِت الكوبّايَة.

english: Chew carefully. You don’t want to choke on a fishbone.
transliteration: úmɖuɣ bi-rāɧa 3ašān ma-tišráʔšə min šōk issámak.
arabic: أُمْضُغ بِراحة عشان متِشْرقْش مِن شوْك السّمك.

english: I'm so thirsty. Could I have some water?
transliteration: ʔána 3aʈšān ʔáwi. múmkin tiddīni šwáyyit máyya?
arabic: أنا عطْشان أوي.  مُمْكِن تِدّيني شُوَيِّةْ ميّة؟

english: Taste the soup. Does it need salt?
I don’t like how it tastes.
The milk is past its expiration date.
How does the soup taste? - It’s a little salty.
arabic: أيْه رأْيَك في الشّورْبة؟ - مالْحة شُوَيَّة.

english: Potato chips are really bad for you.
If I feel hungry, I just have a small snack.
transliteration: lámma -ɧiss ʔínni ga3ān, baʔázʔaz ʔayyə ɧāga xafīfa.
arabic: لمّا أحِسّ إنّي جعان، بقزْقز أيّ حاجة خفيفة.

english: Can I have a glass of water, please?
There’s a can of cola in the fridge.
How would you like your (Turkish) coffee?
Egyptian ghee (made from water buffalo milk)
Eat your ice cream before it melts.
transliteration: kul ilʔāys krīm bitā3ak ʔablə ma ydūb.
arabic: كُلّ الآيس كْريم بِتاعك قبْل ما يْدوب.

english: Areesh cheese (similar to cottage cheese or Ricotta)
Halloumi cheese (semi-hard, unripened cheese made from goat milk)
Romy cheese (a sharp, pungent, hard cheese)
Dark chocolate is better for you than milk chocolate.
arabic: الشّوكولاتة الغامْقة أحْسنْلك مِن الشّوكولاتة بِاللبن.

english: kahk (shortbread stuffed with dates and nuts)
om ali (a very popular sweet bread pudding)
qatayef (sweet dumpling with nuts and cream)
I don’t feel like chicken. Let’s have beef.
transliteration: miš 3āyiz ʔākul firāx. ta3āl nigīb láɧma.
arabic: مِش عايِز آكُل فِراخ.  تعال نِجيب لحْمة.

english: This meat has a lot of fat on it.
This meat has a lot of fat on it.
Thank you for the meal! (said to host(ess) after having tried the food)
to talk with one’s mouth full
Don’t talk with your mouth full!
Could you pass the salt, please?
Excuse me for a moment. (when excusing oneself from the table)
Thank you for the meal. (said after finishing a meal in someone’s home)
I don’t feel well. I think I need to go see a doctor.
transliteration: ʔána ta3bān. ʔa3táqid lāzim ʔarūɧ li-duktūr.
arabic: أنا تعْبان.  أعْتقِد لازِم أروح لِدُكْتور.

english: The doctor examined him and diagnosed him with nasal congestion.
transliteration: idduktūr kášaf 3alē wi šáxxaȿu ʔínnu 3ándu zukām.
arabic: الدُّكْتور كشف عليْه و شخّصُه إنُّه عنْدُه زُكام.

english: My shoulder has been hurting for ages.
I have a really bad headache.
to be congested, have nasal congestion
He broke his arm and has to wear a cast now.
transliteration: kásar dirā3u w lāzim yirákkib gabīra dilwáʔti.
arabic: كسر دِراعُه و لازِم يِركِّب جبيرة دِلْوَقْتي.

english: to perform surgery on, operate on
to perform surgery on, operate on
to undergo surgery, have an operation
to undergo surgery, have an operation
I’m going to the dentist’s to get a check-up and a cleaning.
transliteration: ʔána rāyiɧ li-duktūr issinān 3ašān ʔá3mil kíšfa 3ála sināni wi ʔá3mal tanɖīf.
arabic: أنا رايِح لِدُكْتور السِّنان عشان أعْمِل كِشْفة على سِناني و أعْمِل تنْضيف.

english: I need to practice speaking more.
transliteration: ʔána miɧtāg ʔatdárrab 3ála -lmuɧádsa ʔáktar min kída.
arabic: أنا مِحْتاج أتْدرّب على المُحادْثة أكْتر مِن كِده.

english: You can’t understand anything he says.
I can speak a little Arabic.
I can get by in Arabic.
How do you pronounce this word?
Your Arabic pronunciation is quite good.
I need to work on my listening skills in Arabic.
arabic: لازِم أشْتغل على تمارين السّماع بِالعربي.

english: to look up a word in the dictionary
I live in Egypt, the mother of the world.
arabic: أنا عايِش في مصْر أُمّ الدُّنْيا.

english: Happy birthday and may you have many more!, … and many happy returns!
transliteration: kullə sána w ʔínta ʈáyyib wi 3uʔbāl mīt sána, ʔin šāʔ ʔałłāh!
arabic: كُلّ سنة و إنْتَ طيِّب و عُقْبال ميةْ سنة إن شاء اللّه!

english: He’s turning ten years old next week.

arabic: تمّيْت تلاتين سنة الشّهْر اللي فات.

transliteration: itwaládtə sánit ʔalfə tús3u míyya w tamanīn.
arabic: اِتْوَلدْت سنِةْ ألْف تُسْعُمية و تمانين.

english: in view of; with respect to
How did you work that out in your head? I need a calculator!
transliteration: ʔínta ɧasábtə da b-dimāɣak izzāy? ʔána miɧtāg ʔāla ɧásba!
arabic: إنْتَ حسبْت ده بِدِماغك إزّايْ؟ أنا مِحْتاج آلة حاسْبة!

english: Add up the price of all the items to get the total.
transliteration: ígma3 si3rə kull ilɧagāt 3ašān tí3raf ʔigmāli -ssi3r.
arabic: اِجْمع سِعْر كُلّ الحاجات عشان تِعْرف إجْمالي السِّعْر.

english: Subtract the smaller amount from the larger one to find the difference.
transliteration: íʈraɧ irráqam iȿȿuɣáyyar min ilkibīr 3ašān tí3raf ilfárʔ.
arabic: اِطْرح الرّقم الصُّغيّر مِن الكِبير عشان تِعْرف الفرْق.

english: Multiply the length and width to find the area of the rectangle.
transliteration: íɖrab iʈʈūl fi -l3arɖ 3ašān tíɧsib misáɧt ilmustaʈīl.
arabic: اِضْرب الطّول في العرْض عشان تِحْسِب مِساحْةْ المُسْتطيل.

english: Divide the total by the number of people to find the average.
arabic: اِقْسِم الرّقم على عدد النّاس عشان تِعْرف المُتَوَسِّط.

english: Twenty divided by four equals five.
There are twenty books, and the twentieth book is mine.
transliteration: fī 3išrīn kitāb w ilkitāb il3išrīn bitā3i.
arabic: فيه عِشْرين كِتاب و الكِتاب العِشْرين بِتاعي.

english: Let’s go for a walk in the park.
We hung out at the shopping mall yesterday evening.
I like to sit in a coffee shop and read the newspaper before I go to work.
transliteration: baɧíbb ʔáʔ3ud fi -lʔáhwa wi ʔáʔra -lgurnān ʔablə ma -rūɧ iššúɣl.
arabic: بحِبّ أقْعُد في القهْوَة و أقْرا الجُرْنان قبْل ما أروح الشُّغْل.

english: Have you ever been on TV?

arabic: أيْه أكْتر بِرْنامِج بِتْحِبُّه في التِّليڤِزْيوْن؟

english: What do you like to watch on TV?
arabic: بِتْحِبّ تِتْفرّج على أيْه في التِّليڤِزْيوْن؟

english: I haven’t seen the second season of this show yet.
transliteration: ʔána líssa ma-šúftiš ilmūsim ittāni min ilmusálsal da.
arabic: أنا لِسّه مشُفْتِش الموسِم التّاني مِن المسلْسل ده.

english: There’s an interesting program on channel 3.
arabic: فيه بِرْنامِج حِلْو على القناهْ التّالْتة.

english: I can’t hear what they’re saying. Could you turn the TV up a bit?
transliteration: ʔána miš sāmi3 biyʔūlu ʔē. múmkin ti3álli -ttilivizyōn šuwáyya?
arabic: أنا مِش سامِع بِيْقولوا أيْه.  مُمْكِن تِعلّي التِّليڤِزْيوْن شُوَيَّة؟

english: I’m trying to study. Could you turn the TV down a bit?
arabic: بحاوِل أذاكِر.  مُمْكِن تِوَطّي التِّليڤِزْيوْن شُوَيَّة؟

english: to forward, skip to the next track
to rewind, go back to (the previous track)
Excuse me. Would you take a photo of us?
Let’s go to the cinema this weekend.
A new movie is coming out on Friday. Want to go?
transliteration: fī filmə gdīd ha-yínzil yōm ilgúm3a. tiɧíbbə nrūɧ?
arabic: فيه فيلْم جِديد هَيِنْزِل يوْم الجُمْعة.  تِحِبّ نِروح؟

english: They’re showing a classic movie this evening.
to sit close to the screen
I don’t like to sit too close to the screen.
transliteration: ma-baɧíbbiš ʔáʔ3ud ʔuráyyib ʔáwi min iššāša.
arabic: مبحِبِّش أقْعُد قُريِّب أَوي مِن الشّاشة.

english: What kind of movies do you like?
I love action movies, but I can’t stand romantic movies.
transliteration: ʔána baɧíbb ʔaflām ilʔ[action], bassə miš baʈīʔ ilʔaflām irrumansíyya.
arabic: أنا بحِبّ أفْلام الأكْشِن، بسّ مِش بطيق الأفْلام الرّومانْسية.

english: No, thank you. I don’t smoke.
What is the illiteracy rate in Egypt?
when I was in elementary school, ...
Her son is in first grade.
I’m studying Arabic at a language academy in Cairo.
transliteration: ʔána bádris 3árabi fi ʔakadimíyyit ilʔálsun f- ilqāhíra.
arabic: أنا بدْرِس عربي في أكاديميةْ الألْسُن في القاهِرة.

english: in one’s second year of middle school
in one’s third year of high school
in one’s final year of high school
I have six classes a day.
Class starts at 8 o'clock and finishes at 9 o'clock.
transliteration: ilɧíȿȿa btíbdaʔ issā3a tamánya wi tíxlaȿ tís3a.
arabic: الحِصّة بْتِبْدأ السّاعة تمانْيَة و تِخْلص تِسْعة.

english: to ask a question in class
Copy these sentences into your notebook.
We have a fifteen-minute break between classes.
arabic: عنْدنا فُسْحة رُبْع ساعة بيْن الحِصص.

english: He needs to study for the test.
The students have to write an essay about a historical event.
transliteration: iʈʈálaba -lmafrūɖ yiktíbu mawɖū3 ta3bīr 3an ɧádas tarīxi.
arabic: الطّلبُه المفْروض يِكْتِبوا مَوْضوع تعْبير عن حدث تاريخي.

english: I intend to enroll in an Arabic class next month.
transliteration: nāwi ʔaštírik fi faȿl il3árabi -ššahr ilgáyy.
arabic: ناوي أشْترِك في فصْل العربي الشّهْر الجايّ.

english: to get into college, start university
to get into college, start university
I got into the faculty of medicine, but later I changed to law.
transliteration: daxáltə kullíyyit iʈʈíbb, bassə sibtáha wi daxáltə ɧuʔūʔ.
arabic: دخلْت كُلّيةْ الطِّبّ، بسّ سِبْتها و دخلْت حُقوق.

english: When did you graduate from university?

transliteration: itxarrágtə min ilgám3a sánit ʔalfēn wi xámsa.
arabic: اِتْخرّجْت مِن الجامْعة سنِةْ ألْفيْن و خمْسة.

english: All the freshmen have to attend an orientation ceremony.
arabic: كُلّ الطُّلّاب الجُداد المفْروض يِحْضروا المحاضْرة التّعْريفية.

english: He got a certificate for completing the course.
What was your favorite subject in school?
transliteration: ʔē ʔáktar mádda kuntə bitɧibbáha fi -lmadrása?
arabic: أيْه أكْتر مادّة كُنْت بِتْحِبّها في المدْرسة؟

english: I really enjoyed studying history, but I hated science class.
I really enjoyed studying history, but I hated science class.
transliteration: kuntə baɧíbb ittarīx bassə bákrah il3ulūm.
arabic: كُنْت بحِبّ التّاريخ بسّ بكْرهْ العُلوم.

english: to go for a stroll or outing
* The following names are used in most of the Mashriq
* The following names are used in the Levant. *
I can’t understand a word you’re saying.
Did she carry the box to the kitchen?
He picked the book up from the table.
arabic: هُوَّ شال الكِتاب مِن على الطّرابيْزة.

english: I can’t express myself in Arabic very well.
arabic: مبقْدرْش أعبّر عن نفْسي بِالعربي كْوَيِّس.

english: to finish, come to an end
The ball is floating in the water.
I intend to succeed at my job.
He hasn’t moved in ten minutes.
He set down the book on the table.
The Titanic sank over a hundred years ago.
transliteration: it[Titanic] ɣírʔit min ʔáktar min mīt sána.
arabic: التّايْتانيك غِرْقِت مِن أكْتر مِن ميةْ سنة.

english: weapons that are not firearms (e.g. knives
It’s below zero.; It’s below freezing.
How hot does it get where you’re from?
transliteration: ilgáwwə ɧarrə ʔaddə ʔē fi baládkum?
arabic: الجوّ حرّ أدّ أيْه في بلدْكُم؟

english: Where I’m from, it doesn’t usually get over 30 degrees in the summer.
transliteration: ɣālíban dáragit ilɧarāra ma-bit3addīš talatīn fi -ȿȿēf fi báladi.
arabic: غالِباً درجِةْ الحرارة مبِتْعدّيش تلاتين في الصّيْف في بلدي.

english: It’s hotter than it was yesterday.
khamsin (hot, dusty southerly wind in the spring)
Does it snow where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it snows a lot in the winter.
transliteration: iddúnya bitmáʈʈar talgə ktīr fi -ššíta fi báladi.
arabic: الدُّنْيا بِتْمطّر تلْج كِتير في الشِّتا في بلدي.

english: There was a flash of lightning.
The thunder woke me up last night.
Do you think it’s going to rain?
It looks like (it’s going to) rain.
Cairo has a very arid climate.
I work five days a week.

arabic: دوّر على شِغِل، يْدوِّر على شِغِل
قدّم على شِغِل، يْقدِّم على شِغِل

english: Have you found a job yet?
to finish work, get off work
I work eight hours a day.
transliteration: ána bištíɣil dawēm tmin sē3āt kill yōm.
arabic: أنا بِشْتِغِل دَوام تْمِن ساعات كِلّ يوْم.

english: to stay late at the office
to go on a business trip
I get paid on the first of the month.
I got a promotion this month.

transliteration: nʈárad min šíɣlu, yinʈúrid min šíɣlu

english: I hope to retire when I’m sixty.
